availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Smoloff Palace Love (Muhlenberg County, teacher, merchant, soldier, and lawyer)

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, teacher, merchant, soldier, and lawyer. Lincoln County, Kentucky native. Attended Columbia Academic in Missouri. Served in the 1st Missouri Volunteers from 1846 to 1847. Teacher in Muhlenberg County from 1849 to 1857. Merchant in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as lieutenant colonel and colonel from 1861 to 1864. Lawyer in Greenville, Kentucky in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Subdivision 2, p. 249A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 105.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Greenville, p. 5.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000367186, p. 255.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 248.
James Grant Wilson and John Fiske, eds., Appletonsâ€™ Cyclopedia of American Biography (New York: D. Appleton and Company, 1888), 34.
